intro: Dalechampia cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its ornamental value comes from its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
